verses.verse: The words <S%H1697><s%> of Agur <S%H94><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Jakeh <S%H3348><s%>, even the prophecy <S%H4853><s%>: the man <S%H1397><s%> spoke <S%H5002><s%> unto Ithiel <S%H384><s%>, even unto Ithiel <S%H384><s%> and Ucal <S%H401><s%>,
Surely I am more brutish <S%H1198><s%> than any man <S%H376><s%>, and have not the understanding <S%H998><s%> of a man <S%H120><s%>.
I neither learned <S%H3925><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, nor have <S%H3045><s%> the knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of the holy <S%H6918><s%>.

Who has ascended up <S%H5927><s%> into heaven <S%H8064><s%>, or descended <S%H3381><s%>? who has gathered <S%H622><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%> in his fists <S%H2651><s%>? who has bound <S%H6887><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> in a garment <S%H8071><s%>? who has established <S%H6965><s%> all the ends <S%H657><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>? what is his name <S%H8034><s%>, and what is his son <S%H1121><s%>'s name <S%H8034><s%>, if you can tell <S%H3045><s%>?
Every word <S%H565><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> is pure <S%H6884><s%>: he is a shield <S%H4043><s%> unto them that put their trust in him <S%H2620><s%>.
Add <S%H3254><s%> you not unto his words <S%H1697><s%>, lest he reprove <S%H3198><s%> you <S%H3576><s%>, and you be found a liar.
Two <S%H8147><s%> things have I required <S%H7592><s%> of you <S%H4513><s%>; deny me them not before I die <S%H4191><s%>:

Remove far <S%H7368><s%> from me vanity <S%H7723><s%> and lies <S%H1697><s%>: give <S%H5414><s%> me neither poverty <S%H7389><s%> nor riches <S%H6239><s%>; feed <S%H2963><s%> me with food <S%H3899><s%> convenient for me <S%H2706><s%>:

Lest I be full <S%H7646><s%>, and deny <S%H3584><s%> you <S%H559><s%>, and say, Who is the Lord <S%H3068><s%>? or lest I be poor <S%H3423><s%>, and steal <S%H1589><s%>, and take <S%H8610><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of my God in vain <S%H430><s%>.
Accuse <S%H3960><s%> not a servant <S%H5650><s%> unto his master <S%H113><s%>, lest he curse <S%H7043><s%> you <S%H816><s%>, and you be found guilty.
There is a generation <S%H1755><s%> that curses <S%H7043><s%> their father <S%H1><s%>, and does not bless <S%H1288><s%> their mother <S%H517><s%>.
There is a generation <S%H1755><s%> that are pure <S%H2889><s%> in their own eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and yet is not washed <S%H7364><s%> from their filthiness <S%H6675><s%>.
There is a generation <S%H1755><s%>, O how lofty <S%H7311><s%> are their eyes <S%H5869><s%>! and their eyelids <S%H6079><s%> are lifted up <S%H5375><s%>.

There is a generation <S%H1755><s%>, whose teeth <S%H8127><s%> are as swords <S%H2719><s%>, and their jaw teeth <S%H4973><s%> as knives <S%H3979><s%>, to devour <S%H398><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> from off the earth <S%H776><s%>, and the needy <S%H34><s%> from among men <S%H120><s%>.

The horseleach <S%H5936><s%> has two <S%H8147><s%> daughters <S%H1323><s%>, crying <S%H3051><s%>, Give, give <S%H3051><s%>. There are three <S%H7969><s%> things that are never satisfied <S%H7646><s%>, Yes <S%H702><s%>, four things say <S%H559><s%> not <S%H1952><s%>, It is enough:

The grave <S%H7585><s%>; and the childless <S%H6115><s%> womb <S%H7356><s%>; the earth <S%H776><s%> that is not filled <S%H7646><s%> with water <S%H4325><s%>; and the fire <S%H784><s%> that says <S%H559><s%> not <S%H1952><s%>, It is enough.

The eye <S%H5869><s%> that mocks <S%H3932><s%> at his father <S%H1><s%>, and despises <S%H936><s%> to obey <S%H3349><s%> his mother <S%H517><s%>, the ravens <S%H6158><s%> of the valley <S%H5158><s%> shall pick it out <S%H5365><s%>, and the young <S%H1121><s%> eagles <S%H5404><s%> shall eat it <S%H398><s%>.
There be three <S%H7969><s%> things which are too wonderful <S%H6381><s%> for me <S%H702><s%>, Yes, four which I know not <S%H3045><s%>:

The way <S%H1870><s%> of a eagle <S%H5404><s%> in the air <S%H8064><s%>; the way <S%H1870><s%> of a serpent <S%H5175><s%> upon a rock <S%H6697><s%>; the way <S%H1870><s%> of a boat <S%H591><s%> in the middle <S%H3820><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%>; and the way <S%H1870><s%> of a man <S%H1397><s%> with a maid <S%H5959><s%>.

Such is the way <S%H1870><s%> of a adulterous <S%H5003><s%> woman <S%H802><s%>; she eats <S%H398><s%>, and wipes <S%H4229><s%> her mouth <S%H6310><s%>, and says <S%H559><s%>, I have done <S%H6466><s%> no wickedness <S%H205><s%>.
For three <S%H7969><s%> things the earth <S%H776><s%> is disquieted <S%H7264><s%>, and for four <S%H702><s%> which it cannot <S%H3201><s%> carry <S%H5375><s%>:
For a servant <S%H5650><s%> when he reigns <S%H4427><s%>; and a fool <S%H5036><s%> when he is filled <S%H7646><s%> with food <S%H3899><s%>;
For a odious <S%H8130><s%> woman when she is married <S%H1166><s%>; and a handmaid <S%H8198><s%> that is heir <S%H3423><s%> to her mistress <S%H1404><s%>.
There be four <S%H702><s%> things which are little <S%H6996><s%> upon the earth <S%H776><s%>, but they are exceedingly <S%H2449><s%> wise <S%H2450><s%>:
The ants <S%H5244><s%> are a people <S%H5971><s%> not strong <S%H5794><s%>, yet they prepare <S%H3559><s%> their food <S%H3899><s%> in the summer <S%H7019><s%>;
The conies <S%H8227><s%> are but a feeble <S%H6099><s%> folk <S%H5971><s%>, yet make <S%H7760><s%> they their houses <S%H1004><s%> in the rocks <S%H5553><s%>;
The locusts <S%H697><s%> have no king <S%H4428><s%>, yet go they forth <S%H3318><s%> all of them by bands <S%H2686><s%>;
The spider <S%H8079><s%> takes hold <S%H8610><s%> with her hands <S%H3027><s%>, and is in kings <S%H4428><s%>' palaces <S%H1964><s%>.
There be three <S%H7969><s%> things which go <S%H6806><s%> well <S%H3190><s%>, Yes <S%H702><s%>, four are fitting <S%H2895><s%> in going <S%H3212><s%>:
A lion <S%H3918><s%> which is strongest <S%H1368><s%> among animals <S%H929><s%>, and turns not away <S%H7725><s%> for any <S%H6440><s%>;
A greyhound <S%H4975><s%>; a he goat <S%H8495><s%> also <S%H176><s%>; and a king <S%H4428><s%>, against whom there is no rising up <S%H510><s%>.
If you have done foolishly <S%H5034><s%> in lifting up <S%H5375><s%> yourself <S%H2161><s%>, or if you have thought evil, lay your hand <S%H3027><s%> upon your mouth <S%H6310><s%>.

Surely the churning <S%H4330><s%> of milk <S%H2461><s%> brings forth <S%H3318><s%> butter <S%H2529><s%>, and the wringing <S%H4330><s%> of the nose <S%H639><s%> brings forth <S%H3318><s%> blood <S%H1818><s%>: so the forcing <S%H4330><s%> of wrath <S%H639><s%> brings forth <S%H3318><s%> strife <S%H7379><s%>.
